arm_group.description: epidural anesthesia with 1% lidocaine 10ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 2% lidocaine 5ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 0.9% normal saline 5ml before propofol TCI

brief_summary.textblock:
It is a prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled study to investigate the effect of TEA
      with different block level on propofol concentration during general anesthesia induction.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Thoracic Epidural Anesthesia With Different Block Level on Propofol Induction

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  American Society of Anesthesiologists  (ASA) I-II physical status,

          -  aged 40-60 yr,

          -  BMI 19-25 kg/m2,

          -  undergoing elective gastrointestinal surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with cardiovascular or neurological disease, drug or alcohol abuse and
             absolute contraindications for neuraxial blockade.

intervention.description: epidural anesthesia with 1% lidocaine 10ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 2% lidocaine 5ml before propofol TCI
epidural anesthesia with 0.9% normal saline 5ml before propofol TCI

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Thoracic Epidural Anesthesia With Different Block Level on Propofol Concentration During General Anesthesia Induction

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Anesthesiology, First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University

primary_outcome.description: The effect-site concentration of propofol when loss of consciousness during propofol target-controlled infusing(TCI) induction of anesthesia.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Hospital of China Medical University

secondary_outcome.description: The bispectral index of each patient will be recorded at three different time points,as follows, baseline(the awake phase before epidural anesthesia), 20 mins after epidural anesthesia, loss of consciousness(when the participants are lost eyelash reflex during propofol TCI induction of anesthesia).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour

secondary_outcome.description: The mean arterial pressure of each patient will be recorded at three different time points, as follows, baseline(the awake phase before epidural anesthesia), 20 mins after epidural anesthesia, loss of consciousness(when the participants are lost eyelash reflex during propofol TCI induction of anesthesia).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour

secondary_outcome.description: The heart rate of each patient will be recorded at three different time points, as follows, baseline(the awake phase before epidural anesthesia), 20 mins after epidural anesthesia, loss of consciousness(when the participants are lost eyelash reflex during propofol TCI induction of anesthesia).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia induction, an expected average of half an hour

secondary_outcome.description: The block level 20mins after epidural anesthesia and it is verified by the loss of sensation to alcohol swab before target controlled infusion of propofol.
secondary_outcome.measure: The Block Level of Epidural Anesthesia

clinical_study.source: First Hospital of China Medical University

lead_sponsor.agency: First Hospital of China Medical University

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
